it.polimi.ingsw.cg11.communication.server

Class Broker

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.cg11.communication.server.Broker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BrokerInterface, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, java.util.Observer

    public class Broker
extends java.lang.Object
implements BrokerInterface, java.util.Observer, java.io.Serializable
    The Broker of the server, it is the publisher of the event messages to send to the clients
    Author:
    GerlandoSavio
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Broker()
      Constructor for the broker Initializes the map of the topics and creates an executor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTopic(Model newGame)
      simple method to add a game to the broker and initialize the list of subscribers;
      SubscriberInterface createSocketSubscriber()
      Since a client that uses sockets can't send its subscriberhandler through the createGame or joinGame method we create one just for it
      void removeTopic(Model game)
      Method to delete a game from the ones the broker expects updates.
      void subscribe(SubscriberInterface subscriber, java.util.UUID clientId)
      The subscribe method of the broker provides an unified way for rmi and sockets clients to subscribe to a game.
      void update(java.util.Observable game, java.lang.Object eventMessage)
      The broker observers all the games in the game manager, so that when we receive an update from the model we can send a message to all the subscribers relative to that game.

    • Method Detail

      • addTopic

        public void addTopic(Model newGame)
        simple method to add a game to the broker and initialize the list of subscribers;
        Parameters:
        newGame -

      • removeTopic

        public void removeTopic(Model game)
        Method to delete a game from the ones the broker expects updates.
        Parameters:
        game - the topic to remove

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable game,
          java.lang.Object eventMessage)
        The broker observers all the games in the game manager, so that when we receive an update from the model we can send a message to all the subscribers relative to that game.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        game - the model that notified a change
        eventMessage - the message we need to dispatch to the subscribers

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe(SubscriberInterface subscriber,
             java.util.UUID clientId)
        The subscribe method of the broker provides an unified way for rmi and sockets clients to subscribe to a game. If the communication is sockets we create a new subscriber handler and run it, otherwise we look up on the registry the subscriber interface for the client on which we call the dispatch message method.
        Specified by:
        subscribe in interface BrokerInterface
        Parameters:
        clientId - the unique id of the client we use to look him up on the registry
        subscriber - the interface on which the broker calls the dispatch message method

      • createSocketSubscriber

        public SubscriberInterface createSocketSubscriber()
        Since a client that uses sockets can't send its subscriberhandler through the createGame or joinGame method we create one just for it
        Returns:
        new subscriber interface through sockets
